Package tage.rml

Class Matrix2f

java.lang.Object
tage.rml.Matrix2f
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix2
public final class Matrix2f extends Object implements Matrix2
An immutable single-precision floating point column-major 2x2 square matrix.

This means the following inputs: 

 float[] { 1, 2, 3, 4 };
 float[][] {
     { 1, 2 },
     { 3, 4 }
 };
produce the following matrix layout:

1 3 2 4

The implementation assumes the input arrays have enough elements to build the matrix. When the input array does not have enough elements, an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown. However, when the input array has extra elements, the extra data are ignored.

Author:
Raymond L. Rivera

    • createInverseFrom

      public static Matrix2 createInverseFrom(float[] values)
      Creates a new inverse matrix from the specified values, if possible.
      Parameters:
      values - An array of at least 4 values, in column-major order.
      Returns:
      A new inverse matrix calculated from the specified values.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - If the values represent a singular matrix. A singular matrix is non-invertible because its determinant is zero.
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the input array has less than 4 elements.

    • createInverseFrom

      Throws:

      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the input array has less than 2 elements per dimension.

    • determinant

      public float determinant()
      Description copied from interface: Matrix2
      Returns the determinant of this matrix.

      Note that if the determinant is zero, then this matrix is singular and cannot be inverted.

      Specified by:
      determinant in interface Matrix2
      Returns:
      The determinant of this matrix.

    • inverse

      public Matrix2 inverse()
      Description copied from interface: Matrix2
      Returns a new matrix that is the inverse of this matrix, if possible.

      If this matrix is a singular matrix, then it's not possible to calculate its inverse.

      Specified by:
      inverse in interface Matrix2
      Returns:
      The inverse of this matrix.
